President johnson signed the federal income
tax cut last week with several pens. Before the
ink could dry other expenditures for defense
and foreign aid rose higher.


The baycheck Of many salaYied employees
wiH be larger for the next pay periods, but
the increase viii be almost unnOticed in many
cases. Unfortunately the tax cut came at the
time Mhen the johnson admins tyatiOn has de-
cided to spend aOlaile cutting the budget.


haeQuities in the federal income tax SChed-
ules should be studied and a revised tax bro
gram should be made to include more persons.

from scant 5000. Medical expenses should
be allowed for the fun amounts.

onay as many persons predict. is too small

store evokes the usual mild in
terest. A new store can cause
furry of patrons if 1t dispenses
something novel, valuable or
cheap.


Several weeks ago a new shop
opened on North Central Avenue.
There was nothing novel, valuable
nor cheap displayed. The shop
bore a simple almost drab ap-
pearance. There we're no costly
trappings nor elegantly suited
floor walkers. There we're no
elaborate decorations nor pres
tige requirements.


The place had to be found for
it was practically hidden in
row of offices. The front parking
area was small and the sign
was nearly obscure.


The first time | went to find
the place = | drove by and had
to circle the block. Going inside
brought some sensations. The
aromas of pastries filled the air.


The rows of delicacies shone
underneath the cleaning count
erglass. The clerks deity placed
flaky pies, rolls or cookies in
boxes. A special order of blue
and white cake squares stared at
me invitingly.


| stood and let my eyes move
from one section of the display
cases to another. The taste buds
tingled and | wished that | was
not allergic to the varieties of
fruit bedecked sweets | saw.


have always loved to bake and
eat pastries. My favorites must
be plain because am allergic
to fruits and choc olates. In wilder
moments will press my luck
and treat myself to bit Of cho-
colate.


There we're Choux a la creme
Cream filled buns), cellars,
madeleines (tea cakes), brooches,
bllets doux (custard squares),
bigoudens diamond biscuits),
tarte aux pommes ct cerises
(open apple and cherry pies) and
napoleons Qayered pastry
crusts).


Three women came in and one
ratified loudly in German saying
that these we're really German
pastries. Then she laughed and
said some we're of Austrian orr
gin. The manager smiled and
answered her that these we're
French pastries, but every coun-
try called them by a different
name and claimed them as ma
tional dessert.


l had intended merely to look
at the delicacies and purchase
nothing. AS | hesitated calling
upon my second force of will
power. my eyes Veered toward
the cellars. Before could catch
my breath, | had opened my purse
and was preparing to pay for an
eclair. The quarter was in the
bottom of my coin purse-this gave
me time to ask for a second
one.


A dizziness came over me and
in a flash | had ordered a ma
poleon. Clutching my box of for
hidden goodies--I got in my car
and drove homeward. All the way
l felt like a naughty kid who has
sneaked off and bought something
she had been warned against
buying.


Visions of the cellars danced
in my head and | recalled how
l felt the same way when Edward
and | we're in Paris and Madrid
several years ago. After each
lunch or dinner meal a huge
dessert cart was wheeled around
the dining room. 1t was loaded

Critics on all sides haze found a common
whibbi,ag b0y-the American public school
system. During the past de cade myriad Of
reports from all angles haze been Oyitten to
point ont the faults Of the education system,
the school admins traitors and teachers.


Once a year at this time Public School
Week is Observed I'm many cities as time to
giUe bit of credit WheYe credit is due.


There is q great deal right with the public
school system in the United States. There are
many positive features Which are grossly
ignored BY the critics and denOunceYS WhO
usually seek to dis credit the schools.


Never before haze so many pupils from
all uulks of life been sent to public school
system. Never in the annals of any ciUiIz0-
tion has such a great task been undertaken
BY men and WOnaen 1OhO haze devoted their
time and effort to teaching our youth.


The success Of any education system
defends upon the amount of support 1t gets
from the community and the persons who hUe
there. If you haven't uisited school IN your
area lateU-go and see What is being done.
